titles.en: Chapter 58 – The man is saying to his wife that she is prohibited unto him

titles.ar: باب الْخَلِيَّةِ وَ الْبَرِيئَةِ وَ الْبَتَّةِ
titles.en: Chapter 59 – The freed (woman), and the disavowed (woman), and the severed (woman)

titles.ar: باب أَنَّهُ لَا يَقَعُ الْإِيلَاءُ إِلَّا بَعْدَ دُخُولِ الرَّجُلِ بِأَهْلِهِ
titles.en: Chapter 57 – The solemn oath does not occur except after the sleeping of the man with his wife

titles.ar: باب الرَّجُلِ يَقُولُ لِامْرَأَتِهِ هِيَ عَلَيْهِ حَرَامٌ
titles.en: Chapter 58 – The man is saying to his wife that she is prohibited unto him

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف على المشهور - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (21/226)
text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي نَصْرٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ سَمَاعَةَ عَنْ زُرَارَةَ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ سَأَلْتُهُ عَنْ رَجُلٍ قَالَ لِامْرَأَتِهِ أَنْتِ عَلَيَّ حَرَامٌ فَقَالَ لِي لَوْ كَانَ لِي عَلَيْهِ سُلْطَانٌ لَأَوْجَعْتُ رَأْسَهُ وَ قُلْتُ لَهُ اللَّهُ أَحَلَّهَا لَكَ فَمَا حَرَّمَهَا عَلَيْكَ إِنَّهُ لَمْ يَزِدْ عَلَى أَنْ كَذَبَ فَزَعَمَ أَنَّ مَا أَحَلَّ اللَّهُ لَهُ حَرَامٌ وَ لَا يَدْخُلُ عَلَيْهِ طَلَاقٌ وَ لَا كَفَّارَةٌ

فَقُلْتُ قَوْلُ اللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ يا أَيُّهَا النَّبِيُّ لِمَ تُحَرِّمُ ما أَحَلَّ اللَّهُ لَكَ فَجَعَلَ فِيهِ الْكَفَّارَةَ فَقَالَ إِنَّمَا حَرَّمَ عَلَيْهِ جَارِيَتَهُ مَارِيَةَ وَ حَلَفَ أَنْ لَا يَقْرَبَهَا فَإِنَّمَا جَعَلَ عَلَيْهِ الْكَفَّارَةَ فِي الْحَلْفِ وَ لَمْ يَجْعَلْ عَلَيْهِ فِي التَّحْرِيمِ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Sahl Bin Ziyad, from Ibn Abu Nasr, from Muhammad Bin Sama’at, from Zurara,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup>, said, ‘I asked him<sup>asws</sup> about a man who says to his wife, ‘You are prohibited unto me’. So he<sup>asws</sup> said to me: ‘If there was authority for me<sup>asws</sup> upon him, I<sup>asws</sup> would have pained his head, and said to him: ‘Allah<sup>azwj</sup> has Made her Permissible for you, so what is prohibiting her unto you?’ It does not increase upon a lie if he claims that whatever Allah<sup>azwj</sup> has Permitted for him is prohibited, and a divorce does not enter upon him, nor an expiation’.

So I said, ‘(What about) the Words of Allahazwj Mighty and Majestic [66:1] O Prophet! Do not deny (yourself) that which Allah has made lawful for you, so Heazwj Made the expiation to be with regards to it?’ So heasws said: ‘But rather hesaww forbid unto himself a slave girls Mariah (the Coptic), and swore that hesaww would not go near her. But rather the expiation was Made to be upon himsaww regarding the swear, and was not Made upon himsaww for the prohibition’.
en.sarwar: 1. A number of our people have narrated from Sahl ibn abu Nasr from Muhammad ibn Sama‘ah from Zurarah who has said the following: “I once asked abu Ja’far, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about the case of a man who says to his wife, ‘You are unlawful for me.’ He (the Imam) said to me, ‘Had I the control over him I would give him a headache. You should have said to him that Allah has made her lawful for you then what has made her unlawful for you? In fact it (saying, ‘You are unlawful for me’) is nothing more than a lie. He thus has thought that what Allah has made lawful for him has become unlawful and there is no divorce or expiation on him? I then asked about the meaning of the words of Allah, most Majestic, most Glorious, ‘O Prophet, why do you make unlawful what Allah has made lawful for you’ (65:2) then expiation is made necessary.’ He (the Imam) said, ‘He only made unlawful for him his slave-girl, Maria and swore not to go near her. He, in the case of swearing, made expiation necessary not in the case of making something unlawful.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (1/227)
text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ عُمَرَ بْنِ أُذَيْنَةَ عَنْ زُرَارَةَ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ قُلْتُ لَهُ مَا تَقُولُ فِي رَجُلٍ قَالَ لِامْرَأَتِهِ أَنْتِ عَلَيَّ حَرَامٌ فَإِنَّا نُرْوَى بِالْعِرَاقِ أَنَّ عَلِيّاً ( عليه السلام ) جَعَلَهَا ثَلَاثاً فَقَالَ كَذَبُوا لَمْ يَجْعَلْهَا طَلَاقاً وَ لَوْ كَانَ لِي عَلَيْهِ سُلْطَانٌ لَأَوْجَعْتُ رَأْسَهُ ثُمَّ أَقُولُ إِنَّ اللَّهَ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ أَحَلَّهَا لَكَ فَمَا ذَا حَرَّمَهَا عَلَيْكَ مَا زِدْتَ عَلَى أَنْ كَذَبْتَ فَقُلْتَ لِشَيْ‏ءٍ أَحَلَّهُ اللَّهُ لَكَ إِنَّهُ حَرَامٌ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Umar Bin Azina, from Zurara,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup>, said, ‘I said to him<sup>asws</sup>, ‘What are you<sup>asws</sup> saying regarding a man who says to his wife, ‘You are prohibited unto me’, for we are reporting at Al-Iraq that Ali<sup>asws</sup> made it to be as three (divorces)?’ So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘They are lying! He<sup>asws</sup> did not make it to be as a divorce, and if there was an authority for me<sup>asws</sup> over him, I<sup>asws</sup> would pain his head, then I<sup>asws</sup> would be saying that Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic has Made her to be Permissible for you, so what is that which prohibits her unto you? It would not be any more a life if you were to say for something which Allah<sup>azwj</sup> has Permitted it for you, that it is prohibited’.
en.sarwar: 2. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘Umayr from ‘Umar ibn ‘Udhaynah from Zurarah who has said the following: “I once asked abu Ja’far, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about the case of a man who says to his wife, ‘You are unlawful for me.’ We in Iraq narrate that Ali, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, made it three times (divorce). He (the Imam) said, ‘They have spoken a lie. He (the Imam) did not make it (one’s saying, ‘You are unlawful for me’) a divorce. Had I the control over him I would have given him a headache. I then say to him that Allah, most Majestic, most Glorious, has made it lawful for you. You have done nothing other than speaking a lie by saying unlawful what Allah has made lawful.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: مجهول - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (1/227)
text: حُمَيْدُ بْنُ زِيَادٍ عَنِ ابْنِ سَمَاعَةَ عَنِ ابْنِ رِبَاطٍ عَنْ أَبِي مَخْلَدٍ السَّرَّاجِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ قَالَ لِي شَبَّةُ بْنُ عَقَّالٍ بَلَغَنِي أَنَّكَ تَزْعُمُ أَنَّ مَنْ قَالَ مَا أَحَلَّ اللَّهُ عَلَيَّ حَرَامٌ أَنَّكَ لَا تَرَى ذَلِكَ شَيْئاً قُلْتُ أَمَّا قَوْلُكَ الْحِلُّ عَلَيَّ حَرَامٌ فَهَذَا أَمِيرُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ الْوَلِيدُ جَعَلَ ذَلِكَ فِي أَمْرِ سَلَامَةَ امْرَأَتِهِ وَ أَنَّهُ بَعَثَ يَسْتَفْتِي أَهْلَ الْحِجَازِ وَ أَهْلَ الْعِرَاقِ وَ أَهْلَ الشَّامِ فَاخْتَلَفُوا عَلَيْهِ فَأَخَذَ بِقَوْلِ أَهْلِ الْحِجَازِ إِنَّ ذَلِكَ لَيْسَ بِشَيْ‏ءٍ .

en.hubeali: Humeyd Bin Ziyad, from Ibn Sama’at, from Ibn Rabat, from Abu Makhlad,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Shabbat Bin Aqqal said to me<sup>asws</sup>, ‘It has reached me that you<sup>asws</sup> are claiming that the one who says, ‘what Allah<sup>azwj</sup> has Permitted upon me is prohibited’, that you<sup>asws</sup> do not see that as anything?’ I<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘As for your words, ‘I have permitted upon me a prohibition’, so this is what Amir Al-Momineen<sup>asws</sup> made that in the matter of Salama of his wife, and he had sent for a verdict to the people of Al-Hijaz, and the people of Al-Iraq, and people of Syria, so they differed over it. So he took to by the words of the people of Al-Hijaz that, that is not with anything’.
en.sarwar: 3. Humayd ibn Ziyad has narrated from ibn Sama‘ah from Ribat from abu Mukhallad al-Sarraj who has said the following: “Abu ‘ Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, has said that Shabbah ibn ‘ Aqqal once said to me, ‘You think that if one says, “What Allah has made lawful is unlawful for me” (as you believe) does not have any valid effect.’ I said, ‘About your word ‘lawful is unlawful for me’ you can consider what ’Amir al- Mu’minin, al-Walid decided about the issue of Salamah and his wife when he sent for a fatwa from people of Iraq and people of al-Sham who had differences over the issue. He then decided according to the words of the people of al-Hijjaz who say that it does not have any valid effect.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: موثق - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (1/227)
text: حُمَيْدٌ عَنِ ابْنِ سَمَاعَةَ عَنْ صَفْوَانَ عَنْ حَرِيزٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ قَالَ قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) رَجُلٌ قَالَ لِامْرَأَتِهِ أَنْتِ عَلَيَّ حَرَامٌ قَالَ لَيْسَ عَلَيْهِ كَفَّارَةٌ وَ لَا طَلَاقٌ .

en.hubeali: Humeyd, from Ibn Sama’at, from Safwan, from Hareyz, from Muhammad Bin Muslim who said,
‘I said to Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, ‘A man says to his wife, ‘You are prohibited unto me’’. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘There is no expiation upon him, nor a divorce’.
en.sarwar: 4. Humayd ibn Ziyad has narrated from ibn Sama‘ah from Safwan from Hariz from Muhammad ibn Muslim who has said the following: “I once asked abu ‘Abd Allah, ‘Alayhi al-Salam, about the case of a man who says to his wife, ‘You are unlawful for me.’ He (the Imam) said, ‘There is no expiation on him and it is not a divorce.’”
